rbiom 1.0.3.9075

Provides a 'treedata' S4 object for use in ggtree functions.

Source: R/tree_plot.r
tree_data.Rd

Provides a 'treedata' S4 object for use in ggtree functions.

tree_data(biom, reads = TRUE, clades = TRUE)

Arguments

biom

A BIOM object, as returned from read_biom.

reads

Include a 'reads' column indicating the sum of taxa observations belonging to each node/leaf. Default: TRUE.

clades

Notate top-most monophyletic nodes. The default, TRUE, adds a column for every rank in the biom object. A character vector of ranks can also be passed in. If the vector is named, then those names are used for naming the columns in the returned treedata object. Set to NULL to not return any clade notations.

Examples

    library(rbiom)
    
    tree_data(hmp50)
#> 'treedata' S4 object'.
#> 
#> ...@ phylo:
#> 
#> Phylogenetic tree with 490 tips and 489 internal nodes.
#> 
#> Tip labels:
#>   EschC738, Unc92490, Unc02pjp, Unc26984, Unc41900, AntBa370, ...
